pr_title: [BEAM-9642] Enabling SDF exec runners and fixing small bug.

timeline.message:
[BEAM-9642] Enabling SDF exec runners and fixing small bug.

This actually enables SDFs to actually get used. Only basic testing has
been done, though. One of the bugs that was revealed from that testing
was fixed in the ProcessSizedElementsAndRestrictions step.

timeline.author: lostluck

replies.bodyText: Whoops, that was left behind in editing. Fixed
replies.author: youngoli

timeline.bodyText: Note for the performance pass: We can know KV vs not KV from the input PCollection coderat exec/translate.go time, so we can avoid doing this if branch per element.
timeline.author: lostluck

replies.bodyText: Ack. Added a TODO to remind me.
replies.author: youngoli

timeline.bodyText:
NoActionRequiredNit: I don't like that this gets to 6 indentations deep, which is a bit of a readability concern, but I'm not certain that moving this to a helper function would be that helpful. We'd probably need to break it into two helpers, one from handling the graphx.URNDoFn, and then this graph.ParDo block.
These are a changes for another PR though.
timeline.author: lostluck

replies.bodyText: Agreed. I was iffy on it myself since even 5 indentations deep was already getting difficult to follow.
replies.author: youngoli

timeline.author: lostluck
